pullRequest.title: [#2053] Adding registry-internal auto-provisioning properties to devi…
pullRequest.bodyText:
…ce status.
These properties are implemented as a preparation for the implementation of the auto-provisionoing of edge devices connected to gateways which relies on those properties in order to increase the robustness of the implementation.
Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner florian.kaltner@bosch.io

nodes.bodyText: is it important that these are not of the primitive type? IMHO the code will be easier to understand if we do not need to account for null values all over the place ...

beforeCommit.message:
Review Suggestions:
- Fixing setter names
- Adding accidentally left out DeviceStatus class

Changes:
- Adapting JSON property names for status (device properties are camel-cased in contrast to tenant or credential property names)
- Adding unit test making sure that auto provisioning properties are serialized with the expected name

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

afterCommit.message:
Review Suggestions:
- Fixing setter names
- Adding accidentally left out DeviceStatus class

Changes:
- Adapting JSON property names for status (device properties are camel-cased in contrast to tenant or credential property names)
- Adding unit test making sure that auto provisioning properties are serialized with the expected name

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

commit.message:
[#2053] Adding registry-internal auto-provisioning properties to device status.

These properties are implemented as a preparation for the implementation of the auto-provisionoing of edge devices connected to gateways which relies on those properties in order to increase the robustness of the implementation.

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

beforeCommit.message:
Review Suggestions:
- returning simple booleans instead of boxed types

Changes:
- Adapting naming of boolean getters / setter in DeviceDto for consistency
- Adding constant for set operator

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

afterCommit.message:
[#2053] Adding registry-internal auto-provisioning properties to device status.

These properties are implemented as a preparation for the implementation of the auto-provisionoing of edge devices connected to gateways which relies on those properties in order to increase the robustness of the implementation.

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

nodes.bodyText:
please rename to setAutoProvisioned in order to follow the naming scheme used throughout Hono ...
why should we accept null here? Why don't we simply change the param to the primitive type. In the end, that is also what is returned by the corresponding getter ...

nodes.bodyText: is this class or its methods supposed to be extended/overridden?

+import java.util.Optional;

+import org.eclipse.hono.util.RegistryManagementConstants;
+
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;

+/**
+ * A status used in Device value object.

+@JsonInclude(value = JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL)
+public class DeviceStatus extends Status<DeviceStatus> {

nodes.bodyText: if the class itself is no longer final, then maybe its methods should be?
there doesn't seem to be any P involved in this method, or am I mistaken?
wouldn't it be easier to keep a DeviceStatus typed field instead of duplicating the DeviceStatus properties here?

commit.message:
Review Suggestions:
- Renaming setters in DeviceStatus
- Adding final modifier for DeviceStatus class and for methods of previously final Status class
- Removing obsolete generic type parameter "P" from DeviceDto
- Using DeviceStatus field in DeviceDto

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

nodes.bodyText: is there a particular reason why we do not simply pass a DeviceStatus instance as a parameter to this method? Or do you want to hide the existence of DeviceStatus to client code?

commit.message:
Review Suggestions:
- Refactoring DeviceDto.forRead() so that it takes a DeviceStatus instance in order to shorten parameter list

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

nodes.bodyText: what about forCreation and forUpdate? It seems odd that one method accepts the DeviceStatus as arg but the others require DeviceStatus' properties explicitly, doesn't it?
